DOC.brief_summary: Altered load causative factor development knee osteoarthritis follow anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction ( ACLR ) , real-time biofeedback may effective intervention manipulate alter mechanical loading knee . The purpose study 1 ) determine ACLR participant able acquire retain various load pattern use real-time biofeedback , 2 ) determine effect alter load low extremity biomechanics walk gait , 3 ) determine effect alter load biochemical marker collagen turnover inflammation walk gait .
DOC.detailed_description: Participants attend 4 testing session . Lower extremity biomechanical outcome blood sample take follow participant walk self-selected speed 20 minute . During 20 minute treadmill walk real-time biofeedback display attempt alter mechanical loading . Participants complete control , overload , under-loading , average load test session . Order load condition randomize .
DOC.criteria: Have history primary , unilateral ACLR use either hamstring patellar tendon autograft , clear physical full return physical activity limitation , participate least 30 minute physical activity 3 time per week History injury either leg , ACLR ( e.g . ankle sprain , muscle strain ) , within 6 month prior participation study , history low extremity surgery ACLR , history osteoarthritis current symptom related knee osteoarthritis ( e.g . pain , swell , stiffness ) , currently pregnant , plan become pregnant enrolled study , cardiovascular restriction limit participant 's ability participate physical activity .
